page.title: 15LANGUAGE IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: People in Ballindalloch speak a mixture of English and the local dialect called Doric.Some expressive dialect words and phrases in daily use are:- 'trauchled'(harassed)'dreich'(bleak) 'loons and quines'(boys and girls) 'scutter'(nuisance)'scunner'(disgust) 'vrocht'(worked)'deoch an doruis' (Gaelic,a farewell drink)'thrapple' (throat) 'dirl'(vibrate)'dour'(sullen, serious)'bide'(stay)'greet'(weep) 'chauve'(struggle,effort)'whaup' (curlew)'gowk'(cuckoo,fool)'ben' (through)'spunks'(matches for lighting)'teuchat'(lapwing)'couthy' (friendly)'drookit'(drenched) 'drouthy'(thirsty)'fleg' (frighten). The'Gab o' May'refers to the stormy weather which often comes about the beinning of May.
